title: Can I submit my own support article or guide on Mozilla Support?
content: A common problem when trying to submit your own support article or guide on Mozilla Support is navigating the strict approval process. Mozilla Support has guidelines that must be followed to ensure content quality and relevance. If your article doesn't meet these standards or if it lacks sufficient detail, it may be rejected. Additionally, the community moderators prioritize existing contributors with experience, so new submitters may face difficulty getting their articles reviewed and published. Another challenge is ensuring your article addresses common issues that align with Mozilla's audience needs, making it hard to stand out among many other contributions. Click here for further Knowledge

title: captions
content:
i don't want to change browsers so how do i do this on firefox? Captioning for tutorial videos: Live Captions in Chrome Browser (Version 89 or Higher) Live Caption is only available in English.

title: Advanced Optimization Tips for Faster and More Efficient Firefox Performance
content:
Hi,

I’m looking for ways to optimize Firefox for maximum speed and efficiency, especially in terms of startup time, memory usage, and page load speed. When I open this website (prayertimesriyadh.com) to check my prayer times, it often loads slow for the first time. 

I’m interested in more advanced optimizations, particularly within `about:config`. Are there specific settings that can:

- Reduce RAM and CPU usage while keeping performance smooth? - Improve tab management and prevent slowdowns with multiple open tabs? - Optimize rendering and scrolling for a more responsive browsing experience? - Enhance network settings for faster page loading?

Additionally, are there any recommended third-party tools or built-in developer options that can help diagnose and fine-tune performance? I’d appreciate any expert advice or tested strategies!

title: Lost Firefox bookmarks and history
content:
I’ve been having problems with Firefox on my Dell laptop, running Windows 11. (Firefox has been my default browser for years). For the last few weeks, when I opened Firefox, the history sidebar would always appear by default, and I would have to close it manually. Of course, having the sidebar open didn’t seem to affect the functionality of the program, I just found it a tiny bit bothersome.

Recently I tried uninstalling and reinstalling Firefox to see if that would solve the glitch, but it did not. Even worse, I’ve lost ALL my bookmarks and YEARS of browsing history.

Is there ANY way to retrieve them?

In retrospect, the glitch itself was/is just a minor annoyance, but losing my bookmarks and history is devastating‼️ Thanks
creator: philipshantz

title: Nelle pagina iniziale di Firefox, sotto la banda di ricerca, avevo 5 icone di siti che utilizzavo frequentemente. Sono sparite. Forse ho fatto qualcosa di sbagliato nelle impostazioni, ma ora non so come ripristinarli. Grazie
content: Nelle pagina iniziale di Firefox, sotto la banda di ricerca, avevo 5 icone di siti che utilizzavo frequentemente. Sono sparite. Forse ho fatto qualcosa di sbagliato nelle impostazioni, ma ora non so come ripristinarli. Tra l'altro recentemente ho notato che era possibile aggiungerne altri, di siti, perchè immediatamente dopo l'ultimo di essi compariva un "+" bello grande, cliccando il quale si andava avanti inserendo una nuova icona. Da un po' di tempo questo non era possibile. Ma da oggi è sparito tutto. Ho il sospetto che ci sia una ragione a questo! Grazie.

title: problem with Firefox loggin into facebook
content: good day, I made a few changes on Facebook, then I battled to log in to Facebook again. I tried with Chrome NO PROBLEM, I also tried Edge also NO PROBLEM. Now I use a password manager, so I KNOW I am using the same password all the time on my PC. BTW on my iPhone I can also login without an issue. So I uninstalled Firefox 2x now using Revo uninstaller and removed all files from my PC. On Re-installing Firefox I installed as a fresh install..... But when I open it, Firefox, all my recent sites are still there??? When I try login to Facebook, again it asks me to confirm I am human.When I do that it takes me back to the FB login screen. The I try and login MANUALLY with my credentials that work on all other browsers, and the same thing happens and so it loops around and around, so I cannot login to Facebook from Firefox - and I cannot fathom why not. In the second installation i removed ALL passwords in Firefox. I then logged into Facebook on Chrome and made sure I do not have @FA in Facebook which I do not, so I'm really stymied. Hope someone can advise/assist with resolving this very strange issue. Should you need Screen grabs please let me know and I will get them to you

title: manage account link does not work and profile pic won't populate
content:
In the password login page in the upper right hand corner the manage account link takes me to "session expired" and my profile pic will not populate and my display name is not displayed.

Any ideas why this might be happening?

It was fine and was displaying all the info and my old profile pic except I just went through a legal name change for gender affirming reasons (mtf) and when I changed it, it went blank and stopped functioning properly. It shows the new email only and clicking on that takes me to a "session expired"

https://accounts.firefox.com/settings?context=oauth_webchannel_v1&entrypoint=password-manager&uid=3d83334e2df54c189af324e342703f91&email=katophile6%40proton.me

I have to strip off everything but https://accounts.firefox.com and then sign in. ANd it lets me in.

But I see that I'm not signed into the browser and when I try, I used the auth code and it says bad request.

So since I changed my account name, I'm now locked out.

title: Translate Selection To...
content:
I appreciate the "Translate Selection To" in the right click context menu is in Beta. For me it works but not as well as it might. For example, I am English, my laptop is set to English, I am viewing a website in English but it has some foreign text on it, so I hightlight the text, right click and I am offered to "Translate Selection To ... Slovenian" Why???

I then have to tell it the language of the source/highlighted text and I have to tell it I want the result in English. I can accept it might not recognise the language of the source text but it is very annoying that it assumes I want it converted to Slovenian instead of the systems default language.

To make it worse, having changed the languages to those I want, it doesn't remember them and the next time I use it I'm back to square one.

This would be a really useful feature if only it was logical.

Regards Shutey
creator: shutey56

title: Firefox will only show tab crash reporter
content:
When I open firefox, or try to go to any page at all, all that I get is the tab crash reporter.

I have uninstalled and reinstalled, including removing all old profiles. So I now have no extensions or add-ons enabled. I have disabled hardware acceleration.

firefox does run successfully in troubleshooting mode, so that must be doing something different. But I have not been able to make it run out of troubleshooting mode.

There is nothing in about:crashes, or in AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Crash Reports

What could be going wrong?

title: Temporarily forget master password
content:
Imagine this scenario:

  1. I start Firefox and go to a page that requires a login, so I enter my master password.
  2. I leave my computer.
  3. Somebody else accesses my computer. They can go to any site they want, since Firefox 'remembers' my master password.

How can I protect myself from this? I can close Firefox, I can log off my computer or I can use a screen-saver password.

I would prefer a solution within Firefox, something like a button (possibly under Application Menu → Passwords) to force the master password to be re-entered the next time it is required.
creator: 2PeterW

title: Laggy google docs :(
content:
When using firefox, and only when using firefox, I experience quite a lot of lag when using "google docs" (https://docs.google.com) and only when using "google docs", eg. this does not apply to, say, MS Word or google presentations.

Like I said this only applies to firefox, meaning google chrome and microsoft edge both work fine.

Here are some of the troubleshooting steps I've tried, without success: 

  Launching in troubleshooting mode 
  Disabling 0-RTT 
  Disabling hardware acceleration

These issues do not appear on my machine at home, which also uses firefox, that however is a different version of Windows, an AMD cpu and a dedicated GPU instead of integrated, so idk if that narrows it down even one bit...

The computer on which the issues appear on is a HP Spectre x360 14, which if you don't want to search it up means I have 32gb of RAM @ ~7500MT/s, and an Intel Core Ultra 7 155H as my CPU.

I'd love to keep using firefox without having to fire up chrome every time i need to write/edit a document, which, as a student, is quite often...

Thanks a lot!

title: Gmail non mi fa uscire dal mio account
content:
Buongiorno,

Da ieri Gmail dopo l'accesso non mi fa più uscire dal mio account se uso l'app Firefox dal cellulare. In effetti non riesco neanche a uscire se uso l'app Gmail. Ci riesco comunque dal PC, per adesso. Dal cellulare dopo che "chiudo tutto" per accedere di nuovo devo comunque procedere come al solito. Cioè usare l'usuale processo; inserire la password. Non so se questo è veramente un problema oppure no.

Grazie mille, Ernesto Esposito

title: Redirected URLs are getting mangled on Linux Firefox desktop
content:
OS: Xubuntu 24.04.1 Firefox: All version for quite a long time up through version 135.

In general I have no problem with direct URLs loaded into Firefox, whether from local links or from remote sites.

However, sometimes, possibly as a result of an embedded link in an email, or from a site that pops-up a new instance of the default browser (i.e., Firefox), the URL is mangled with a local filesystem path prepended to the proper URL. The path seems to be one that Firefox accessed in the recent past. For example, a path such as: /usr/local/bin

When the browser starts up, The URL field will show: /usr/local/binhttps://.........

I then have to delete the leading path component before I can access the URL. I'd include a test case if I could find something repeatable that I could post here, but at the moment I don't have one.

Any ideas why this is happening and any suggestions for a way to stop it.

Thanks.
creator: quant

Is there any reason for this as I really don't like to use any other browser other than Firefox but it seems to be that I have to. Is there some way that I can get around this?
